list: Unfinished oak base cabinet can be painted, stained or left as is to coordinate with your decor
Transitional flat panel door complements a variety of design styles
Solid wood face frame provides stability and complements a variety of kitchen styles
1 drawer provide convenient storage for items like utensils and cookware
Limited lifetime warranty gives you peace of mind

reviews.title: "Decent cabinet for a bargain price"
reviews.text: I chose this cabinet because of it's simplicity, real wood front, and it's harmony with other antique cabinets in my kitchen. I was aware that it's cheap particle board back and sides could be a problem, but thought it worth the risk. I added a shelf (it does not have one) by drilling for 1/4 inch shelf clips. I used a small drill bit to start the holes before enlarging them, so as not to break the brittle particle board. Corners are glued and a bit fragile, so handle carefully, but once in place it looks good and works well. The grain raised a lot during finishing so it needed some sanding, but worked out nicely in the end.
reviews.author: Annabelle

reviews.title: "12" Unfinished Base Cabinet"
reviews.text: We had to remove the existing cabinets to install a new dishwasher as the apartment didn't have one. So we purchased a 12" unfinished base cabinet to fit next to the dishwasher to fill in the leftover space.  This cabinet was perfect, we'll paint this one white to match the other cabinets.  The drawer is a little higher (about 1/8") on one end but not too worried about it.  I noticed, though, that the cabinet does NOT contain a shelf (and no pre-drilled holes) as noted in the specifications of this cabinet.  I called Lowe's and they said that 12" cabinets do not contain a shelf. So I guess the renters will make do!  I would recommend if a shelf is not needed.....
reviews.author: goldnflax

reviews.title: "Dimensions provided are inaccurate"
reviews.text: The height of the base cabinet is listed as 35 inches but it is really 35 1/8 which does make a different for the space I am putting it into for an existing kitchen setup.  So I was disappointed that the measurements provided were not correct cause this is the same cabinet style as the cabinets I have now.  The cabinet is ok, there was no type of damage to it. You can tell that it is cheap material but the front where it will be seen by everyone is nice and I will be painting it to match the color of the rest of the cabinets. I am sanding down the bottom to lower the height of the cabinet so I can get it under the existing countertop.
reviews.author: PS

reviews.title: "Beautiful, but Not as pictured"
reviews.text: Was disappointed when we recieved this item. Apparently, they no longer have the single drawer model & instead have a dbl drawer. Still nice, but we have our hearts set on a longer drawer set.  So far the lowe's representatives has been very helpful and she even tried tracking down the single drawer model, but no luck.Quality seems to be ok. I won't know until I can stain & finish everything. There are some hardware pieces that could use an ungrade (ie, plastic on the corner joints and drawer runners). The face frame is gorgeous. I am tempted to not stain the oak & instead seal it with a clear coat.
reviews.author: Jkjae

reviews.title: "Excellent for Price"
reviews.text: We purchased these cabinets in 2010 when we did the first half of our kitchen remodel. We painted them with a high quality paint, and they have held up beautifully with no issues at all. Since we have installed them, we have had 2 small children who are constantly slamming them (despite our best efforts) and hanging on the drawers. We have never had a door or drawer break. They do require a bit of sanding and you will want to paint or stain them. But you can't beat them for the price. We are ordering more of these cabinets to finish the kitchen project.
reviews.author: LeahM

reviews.title: "Unfinished Cabinets"
reviews.text: I purchased a full kitchen of these cabinets from Lowes 2-3 years ago and was very happy with the product for the money spent. I painted them and they looked good. 2 months ago, I purchased another set for another property and have been very disappointed. The material they are made of is very cheap. I had my painter to sand them muliple times to get a decent smooth finish. Then after painting, the drawers would not slide properly. I even paid a cabinet maker to work on them while he was installing the countertop. He made them better, however, they still do not work properly. I contacted Lowes by email stating the problem. That has been 3 weeks now with no answer. I called the store and was instructed to leave my number and someone would call me. That has been 2 weeks with no response. I am stuck with these now since they have been installed. Do not buy this product.
reviews.author: Customer

reviews.title: "I'm happy"
reviews.text: They aren't the best. but they could be much worse. we remodeled my kitchen and used all unfinished cabinets from Lowe's. yes u need to carefully inspect them before buying and they are pretty cheaply made. but like the other guy said. "u get what i pay for". all in all.... I'm pretty happy with how everything turned out. we only painted them white. but they took paint well and look good. I feel as long as I don't send a herd of cattle through my kitchen, they'll hold up fine.
reviews.author: waggs

reviews.title: "Stock Cabinets"
reviews.text: Ordered product on line.  For base cabinet states it has a drawer and a shelf.  When delivered, looked inside, no shelf for both base cabinets.  Went to store to resolve issue.  Told that, sorry, it wasn't available for that cabinet even though advertised on line as such. Upon close inspection, not very sturdy.  Not impressed.  You get what you pay for here.  Lesson learned.
reviews.author: Paratrooper

reviews.title: "Decent cabinet for a bargain price"
reviews.text: I chose this cabinet because of it's simplicity, real wood front, and it's harmony with other antique cabinets in my kitchen. I was aware that it's cheap particle board back and sides could be a problem, but thought it worth the risk. I added a shelf (it does not have one) by drilling for 1/4 inch shelf clips. I used a small drill bit to start the holes before enlarging them, so as not to break the brittle particle board. Corners are glued and a bit fragile, so handle carefully, but once in place it looks good and works well. The grain raised a lot during finishing so it needed some sanding, but worked out nicely in the end.
reviews.author: Annabelle

reviews.title: "Base unfinished cabinet"
reviews.text: The cabinet is fine exactly what I needed. The problem was when we got them home one base was brand new out of the box the other had been on the floor exposed for a while. When we pulled off the cardboard that held the door together there is a line up the middle showing the new wood. The rest was darker almost yellow looking. I would have taken it back but decided to paint it instead of staining it. The line would have shown through the stain. They loaded it in the truck so we didn't see it until we got home.
reviews.author: c

reviews.title: "worst interior finish"
reviews.text: i painted the face frames so i had to tape off the inside of boxes.. needless to say when i slow removed the tape it pulled of the finish on the inside i figured it was prefinished wood but apparently it is only a paper that is glued on.. i spent alot of time sanding priming and painting to get to the end and see the inside of my cabinets look aweful!
reviews.author: DanP

reviews.title: "Nice a first glance"
reviews.text: Every face frame on ever base cabinet is not straight. Every side filler panel has a gap in center of the side. Panel is square but face frame is not. Had to perswade face frame center back with 2ft piece of 2x4 and soft mallet.
reviews.author: DDeininger

reviews.title: "Excellent Value!"
reviews.text: For the money ($111 after 25% off) these are great cabinets. They have solid wood front frame, drawer, and doors. The rest of the cabinet is cheap particle board with a faux wood coating on the inside (that's why I note "For the money) but are otherwise solid. I lightly sanded and stained two of these in around two hours. They look great and the doors and drawer seem pretty solid. If you want hi end/quality cabinets, just go pay for them.
reviews.author: Joe

reviews.title: "Not the best"
reviews.text: There is no center post in this cabinet so there is a gap when the doors are closed. There is a black marker circle on one side I could not get off so had to reconfigure so that side was not exposed. Took awhile to get a sticker off, had to sand off the glue residue which now shows through the stain. Inexpensive - yes, cheap - yes.
reviews.author: Barbara

reviews.title: "Love my finished product"
reviews.text: Purchased a whole kitchen upgrade and all that is left is my countertops. The only reason I gave this product a 4 is because of the drawer fronts. We ordered online and picked up in store. Neither one of us noticed there was a cabinet front missing until we got home and unloaded because there's cardboard stapled to the top and bottom to prevent drawers from sliding and doors from opening during transit. Called the store and was able to get it replaced no problem. But then on a second cabinet, after being stained, the drawer was bumped and the top kind of popped off. Tried to screw it back in and it won't stay put. Will probably have to use glue.I used an outdoor semi transparent deck stain. It was mostly due to the color, but it's also mold resistant so that's a plus. Used one coat of stain and 3 coats of poly. I did have to sand them, but I expected to have to do that to begin with. The hinges are adjustable so for that earlier review of there being a gap in the doors... Easily fixable with adjusting (directions tell you how to)Overall I'm excited about my new kitchen cabinets. Will be buying more for my coffee bar and liquor bar in the dining room.
reviews.author: Joi

reviews.title: "Unfinished Base Cabinet"
reviews.text:
I purchased this cabinet 4/18/16 to add to my kitchen Cabinets purchased some 30 years ago. The oak face frame,doors, and drawer front look identical to the old cabinets. 

The old cabinets had 1/2" particle board for the cabinet body and have held up fairly well over the years. The new cabinet has 3/8" particle board and it is extremely brittle. I rented the Lowes truck to cart the new cabinet home. When I got home a 2" x 4" hole had been punched in the back that was not there when I bought the cabinet.

I had to cover one of the sides with 1/8" oak plywood because it was on an exposed end. I used a brad nailer to shoot small pins to hold the plywood to the cabinet along with some glue. The particle board on inside of the cabinet had cratered where ever the pin had entered.
reviews.author: OldSully

reviews.title: "Deceptive pricing, low grade product"
reviews.text: I had flagged this produce for purchase several months ago.  When I opened the link a few days ago, it said it was on sale for $80, marked down from $100.  I bought two as the sale ended the next day.  After picking up the product, I noticed that the sides were no longer finish grade a separate panel was required.  When I opened up this product, it showed that the regular price was $80, not $100..and that it was then on sale for $75.  I bought similar unfinished oak cabinets from Lowes eight years ago.  At that time, the side panels were finish grade.
reviews.author: Backcreek

reviews.title: "No shelves"
reviews.text: Description says 1 drawer and 1 shelf. There are no shelves, unless you think the bottom is a shelf. Overall, they are nice, unless you need a shelf. Have to build in your own shelf.
reviews.author: Bebe

reviews.title: "Right size!"
reviews.text: I wanted something to set groceries, bowls, etc. on that was going into or coming out of my refrigerator. These items were being put on my glass stove top and I didn't like that. This cabinet was the perfect size for the small opening. After staining the cabinet and adding a Formica top, finished on both sides with a back splash, my project was complete.
reviews.author: jscott0623

reviews.title: "Super thin doors"
reviews.text: We've had these installed in our kitchen door about a year. The doors are so thin, one of our kids stuck his knee through one of them, another door had a stool go through it and make another hole, and one has a random hole that we don't know where it came from. It feels like balsa wood or something. So thin and flimsy. They don't seem to be square on the sides either, there's gaps between the cabinets. Definitely not worth what you pay for them, especially when you have to find replacements for the doors in the first year of having them.
reviews.author: Mm

reviews.title: "Definately unfinished"
reviews.text: I'm remodeling a home as a rental and chose to go with these "unfinished" cabinets to save time. Unfinished is right. I'll start at the beginning.First, check your cabinets over very carefully, especially if you are having them delivered. These are built very cheaply, and damage is common. One of my uppers had a hole punched through the back. They were delivered, so I don't know if it happened during delivery or if it was already damaged when loaded into the truck. Lowes exchanged it without a problem. I had to take it back to the store, but that isn't really a hassle since I'm there pretty often anyway.The cabinets themselves are fairly flimsy. I understand that you get what you pay for, but even the particle board used to build them is the cheapest quality. The base cabinets I received have plastic corner braces in the top, with a screw hole for attaching the counter top. This would be a nice feature, if the braces weren't merely stapled to the cabinet. And, I mean stapled with a regular T-50 staple, just one staple on each side mind you. Most of the braces in my base cabinets popped loose just from moving the cabinets around. The drawer slides are attached in a similar flimsy fashion, and will not last long, so be ready to correct that problem too.Next, when you go to "finish" the cabinets, you have a bit of work to do. These cabinets ARE NOT ready for stain. If you're painting them, you might be OK. If you plan to stain them, as I did, get ready for a lot of sanding. The manufacturer apparently only has one grit in their drum sander. From the looks of the heavy scratches in the face frames and doors, I would say it's probably 20 or 40 grit. Every single cabinet I bought has the same sanding marks on the stiles and horizontal door frames. They must build the face frames and door frames then run them through the drum sander with that heavy grit, and don't bother to clean them up. I spent hours sanding with my random orbit sander to try to get rid of those deep scratches. Here's one last note on finishing: Watch out for the glue the manufacturer uses to assemble. They aren't real careful about where it ends up.Once you finally get them stained (or painted), you will find another problem. When you go to hang them, there are NO screw blocks installed. I guess they expect you to just drive screws through that cheap particle board back, which will not hold up for long. I glued 3/4" x 3/4" strips to the top and bottom of the uppers so I had something solid to screw through, without punching through the back.Something else you won't notice in the store (because it's covered by the cardboard label) is the huge gap between the doors on the larger two-door cabinets. A little gap is fine, but nearly 1/2"? Really? The doors didn't come with bumpers either, so I had to buy those.Finally, you have to buy the toe kick and end panels separately. The end panels I can somewhat understand. The interior cabinets don't really need them, since it will never be seen, but no toe kick? That is a part that will always be visible. Lowes is happy to sell you end panels and toe kicks, but if you have a table saw, or are good with a circular saw, you are better off buying a sheet of 1/4" oak plywood and making your own. I have a table saw and for a $30 sheet of plywood, I was able to make my own end panels and kicks, which saved me about $80.I have a well equipped wood shop and maybe it's just the wood worker in me, but these cabinets are of the poorest quality I have ever seen. You get what you pay for, but these are still over priced for what you get. I simply didn't have time to build cabinets, and didn't want to spend a lot for cabinets in a rental, but I'll make time if I ever do this again.The cabinets are installed, and after a lot of prep work they look OK. I have my doubts as to how long they will last though.
reviews.author: Smokeyhill

reviews.title: "Light duty"
reviews.text: I purchased four of these cabinets for a basement Workshop. The price was good and I knew what I was getting. Beware however because these cabinets are very light duty. There is literally no support for the base shelf which is merely a piece of Luan glued to the sides. Over more than a few pounds will likely make it collapse. In order to use it for a workshop cabinet the underside needs to be reinforced and 1/2 inch thick piece of plywood placed over the base Shelf. The drawer is equally light-duty. It is perhaps made for plastic kitchen utensils. It too must be reinforced if it is going to carry boxes of nails, screwdrivers Etc.
reviews.author: Bob

reviews.title: "Drawer warped"
reviews.text: I bought several different base units and they are all terrible. Some of the drawer fronts have a bend in them so they do not fit flush with the cabinet. The doors have large gaps. No amount of sanding will result in a smooth surface, I had to use wood filler in some places. If painting, use several coats of a good primer first.
reviews.author: Lvo

reviews.title: "Wonderful cabinets"
reviews.text: This is a nice sturdy solid oak doors and frame cabinet that you can finish anyway you want. I wish it was solid wood through out, but none are today. Otherwise it is very nice.
reviews.author: Fllady

reviews.title: "No shelf"
reviews.text: How do you make and sell a kitchen cabinet with no shelf. It's literally useless and there's nowhere to add a shelf, no support, no holes for pegs nothing. The sides are cardboard with no way to support normal kitchen appliances, plates etc.
reviews.author: FrustratedDIYer

reviews.title: "low quality"
reviews.text: i wanted cabinets for my new craft room purchased these because the cost was low.  These are actually kitchen cabinets but I would say they are not of good quality they are particle board and poorly constructed again for the price what did I expect
reviews.author: CJ

reviews.title: "Cheaply made..."
reviews.text: The drawers are easily broke. Breaks when you look at it. Grrrr
reviews.author: Christopher

reviews.title: "Unfinished Oak wood cabinet"
reviews.text: This is my 7th unfinished cabinet/cupboard that I have purchased! The quality of construction and materials is very good. I am very pickie about fit and finish and would not keep it if it didn't meet my standards. All wood case frames and door are very smoothly finished however I lightly sand all edges to prevent against tinny slivers from potentially loping up. I believe buyers will be happy with these cabinets.
reviews.author: ThomasP

reviews.title: "Not what I expected"
reviews.text: I bought a couple of unfinished kitchen base cabinets for the bottom of an island that I was building.  I regret it. The backs and sides are made of bottom of the line particle board not even MFD. They are out of square. They will not hold a nail for adding side panels. They face frames warped so the drawers would not close right. The insides are lined with paper do thin that they cannot be sanded. The door panels are also covered with paper to make them look like wood and they warped when painted. Skip the unfinished product for something of quality.
reviews.author: Tom

reviews.title: "OK but not for me"
reviews.text: I returned this cabinet because it was not a good quality product. It looks nice but everything but the front is cheap pressed board & plastic. But most of the pre-made cabinets are the same way. I just needed something stonger
reviews.author: Alice

reviews.title: "Excellent quality and great value!"
reviews.text: I purchased this cabinet as a companion to the sink base 30". The quality is fantastic and this is a great value. Very well constructed. Lowes prices allow me to stretch my dollar much further....Thanks Lowes!!!!
reviews.author: mrsdhmsr

reviews.title: "For my new kitchen island"
reviews.text: We wanted a kitchen island, but everything was so expensive, so I searched the internet and found this idea. We put 2 of these cabinets on either side of a Project Source 24-in W x 35-in H x 23.75-in D Unfinished Door And Drawer Base Cabinet, then hooked them together & topped them with a butcher block from Lowe's. It's just what I wanted. The cabinets were made well & easy to paint. They also have plenty of storage space.
reviews.author: Chellebk

reviews.title: "Perfect Cabinet for a DIY Island"
reviews.text: This cabinet was a great purchase as we needed a good base to build our new kitchen island. The cabinet itself is square and a good height allowing us to build a frame around it and add our countertop. The one critique I would have would be that the the doors are not soft close, but the hardware seems easy enough to change out.Ended up going back to buy a second.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "For my kitchen Island"
reviews.text: We used this cabinet with 2 Project Source 12-in W x 35-in H x 23.75-in D Unfinished Door And Drawer Base Cabinet's on either side. My hubby hooked them together & topped them with a butcher block from Lowe's. It's made the perfect kitchen island. The cabinets were easy to paint & give me lots of storage. Very happy!
reviews.author: Chellebk

reviews.title: "OK but not great"
reviews.text: I returned this cabinet because it was not a good quality product. It looks nice but everything but the front is cheap pressed board & plastic. But most of the pre-made cabinets are the same way. I just needed something stonger
reviews.author: Alice

reviews.title: "Very sturdy cabinet and well built."
reviews.text: Needed a very sturdy narrow cabinet next to the washing machine to keep it from moving. Even before we screwed it to the wall the machine didn't move.
reviews.author: Verad

reviews.title: "Great for price."
reviews.text: Better than other unfinished cabinets readily available.  If you're creative you can make some really nice custom cabinetry with these.
reviews.author: Jay

reviews.title: "Great for the price"
reviews.text: Can't beat the price and with a coat or two of paint they look like a million bucks. Only one coat of paint in the picture.
reviews.author: Justin

reviews.title: "Base Cabinet For Laundry"
reviews.text: Quality was excellent, much more than what I anticipated for the excellent cost. Inside finished off nicely so no effort needed to finish it. Outside needed very little sanding to finish. Would recommend this product and will most likely purchase additional ones for another room.
reviews.author: BDH

reviews.title: "kitchen cabinet"
reviews.text: Added a new section to my kitchen cabinets , which came out real nice.
reviews.author: Clayton

reviews.title: "Great for the price"
reviews.text: If your redoing kitchen on a budget these are perfect!
reviews.author: Jvinson122

reviews.title: "Great quality for the price!"
reviews.text: Great quality! Looked great once painted too!
reviews.author: LA

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: PowerGuy

reviews.title: "So disappointed I cried."
reviews.text: I assumed the quality was as good as finished cabinets but cheaper because the extras weren't done.  I WAS WRONG.Doors don't line up.  Drawers won't close all of the way.  No shelf inside the base cabinets (who does that???)Can't return because the contractors unboxed and painted. So glad I spent the money for quartz countertops for cabinets I completely hate.  Can't add photos because it's hard to take a picture while you're crying.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Value is worth it"
reviews.text: With these cabinets, you get what you pay for:  They have solid wood front frame, drawer face, and doors. The cabinet frame is cheap particle board with a faux wood coating on the inside.  If these are end cabinets, you have to buy an end piece to cover up the particle board so it will look like it is solid wood.  I purchased one 3-drawer base cabinet last year to replace one quickly that fell apart in our kitchen.  It worked out well so I purchased 7 more.  I sanded and stained them and they look beautiful.  They are functional and I'm happy.  If you are willing to put a little effort into these then it is worth it for the cost savings.  If not, the go pay $4-500 for a cabinet this size.  I spent $500 for 7 cabinets (different sizes).
reviews.author: Laura

reviews.title: "Crooked drawer"
reviews.text: Will have to return for another one. The drawer is crooked. Ordered online and really didn't get to inspect it. Will look carefully at the replacement.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Just what I wanted"
reviews.text: Had a little project of utilizing an unused space on the other side of my kitchen counter. Worked perfectly and actually cost less by ordering it online and having it ready to pick up at the store. Sanded it down, painted and framed it in. No shelf comes with it, which is why I didn't give 6 stars, but added my own along with some shelve pegs at minimal cost. Well satisfied with the quality and price.
reviews.author: BillD

reviews.title: "Product Not Worth The Money"
reviews.text: Made super cheap , need to sand them several times to get a some what nice finish.. No quality what so ever in these cabinets
reviews.author: stackerville

reviews.title: "Replaced Trash Compactor"
reviews.text: We pulled the 1980-ish trash compactor and needed a 15" wide replacement for the space.  Considered the wine cooler ($400+), but instead started shopping for a 15" base cabinet.  Lowe's right here in town (Anchorage) had this for a fraction of what many online competitors advertised.  The quality is builders grade, clean and straight.  I was able to cut just a little off the bottom to precisely install in the vacated space.  It looks great and the sanding, stain and finish blended right in with the rest of our kitchen.
reviews.author: moosejive

reviews.title: "Base Cabinet For Laundry"
reviews.text: Quality was excellent, much more than what I anticipated for the excellent cost. Inside finished off nicely so no effort needed to finish it. Outside needed very little sanding to finish. Would recommend this product and will most likely purchase additional ones for another room.
reviews.author: BDH

reviews.text: There is no center post in this cabinet so you can fit larger things in it  I have containers that are 24 inches wide that fit in just fine   I love the cabinets  they are perfect for what I need
reviews.author: tasc

reviews.title: "OK for the money"
reviews.text: The cabinet is ok but only has staples for support at the corners. I reinforced before install but it worked out fine then. Good economical choice.
reviews.author: Roger

reviews.title: "Good product"
reviews.text: Product was well built and easy to install. Make sure to paint or stain, it will absorb a spill when left unfinished.
reviews.author: Steviez

reviews.title: "Door and Drawer Base Cabinet"
reviews.text: Used two these along with several other cabinets to build a workbench in my garage. Very happy with the end results.
reviews.author: Stevo

reviews.text: Was exactly what I Was looking for a used a few cabinets to make a new island
reviews.author: Rick

reviews.title: "Simple cabinet - quality build"
reviews.text: For the price you can't beat this cabinet if you are looking to add a cabinet to your existing kitchen cabinets. The same general style as the original cabinets in our home, we renovated our kitchen and had to add a lower cabinet. Make sure you get the right cabinet height though because there are 34.5” cabinets and 35” cabinets and they sit below your flooring generally so it may be difficult to tell if you haven't taken up flooring to find out it's depth.
reviews.author: Dan

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Matt

reviews.title: "Base Stock cabinet"
reviews.text: Great buy for the DIYer. Could not buy the materials any cheaper.  Rating based on need to beef it up in the back corners.   Add 1/4's along all sides of the bottom.  Have to add counter top blocks.  Stains out great.  Quality of hardware good.  Made my kitchen look good. I am a journeyman cabinet maker and would not hesitate to recommend this and other like cabinets when the cost of the kitchen is to be kept low and the time to do it is important.
reviews.author: Basshunter

reviews.title: "Good quality"
reviews.text: This cabinet, as with all 8 of the cabinets/cupboards by MasterBrand, have been of good quality! I have used other base brands before, but this brand steps above them. All exposed surfaces are of clean solid oak and are ready to either paint, stain or clear coat. Drawers and doors are not cheep. You can purchase an oak veneer sheet and cut it to size to cover any exposed flake board sides of the cabinet or cupboard.
reviews.author: ThomasP

reviews.title: "OK for the price."
reviews.text: You do get a (rough) oak cabinet which will take a little finishing to get it looking good. The only major problem is the cheap particle board box. Cabinet screws can punch through the back if you are not careful. You will also want to attach a ledger underneath the upper cabinets to help support the weight. You get what you pay for, so these are OK.
reviews.author: umabari

reviews.title: "15in Unfinished Door and Drawer Base Cabinent"
reviews.text: This cabinet turned out great in my kitchen remodel. It was the last set needed to tie together all of my base cabinets in my kitchen. They are perfect for a do it yourself project. Easy to install, easy to cut for plumbing, easy to finish with little sanding required before painting/staining/sealing.
reviews.author: Lindsey

reviews.title: "Don't expect too much"
reviews.text: So these are great for limited expectations. I used them to creat a vase for a storage and workbench in the garage. I would not use for a kitchen or other interior purpose. The are truly unfinished and would require LOTS of sanding and finishing. However for a garage they do the trick!
reviews.author: spr1636

reviews.title: "Perfect fit"
reviews.text: Needed to get more storage space next to my stove and I picked this up with the three draw cabinet. I love this because all my baking sheets stand in the cabinet and the draw is perfect for my quick grab cooking tools. We painted ours to match the other cabinets and it looks amazing.
reviews.author: Girlcopter

reviews.title: "Basic Cabinet"
reviews.text: This is a basic cabinet that I am adding to a couple of 24" to make a work bench in my garage.  Will put a piece of plywood with a nice surface side up and seal it with four or five coats of marine varnish.  Makes for a great work area. Four stars because it is only a basic cabinet.
reviews.author: Steve

reviews.title: "A decent cabinet for the price"
reviews.text: This is a pretty solid unit. Well made.  Facing is solid wood. ..the rest is pressed wood and fairly thin. It can be broken if mishandled.   That said, it's put together pretty well.  I coated it with polyurethane and it looks really nice. The drawer slides in and out smoothly.
reviews.author: Bucko

reviews.title: "OK for the Price"
reviews.text: The finish was really rough, but the price was good.
reviews.author: CL

reviews.title: "Not bad, not great cabinets."

reviews.text: The materials used are of average quality. I like the price point and the modular design. This is great for someone that is “handy” and wants to create a living space where individuality can thrive.

reviews.title: "Not Bad"

reviews.title: "Unfinished Cabinet"
reviews.text: This unfinished cabinet was a great price and value to help finish off an empty space in my kitchen that I needed to fill. The quality for the price was excellent. Solid construction.

reviews.title: "Great basic cabinet."
reviews.text: If you're looking to be able to color your cabinets to match a certain theme in the house, these are the ones to buy.

reviews.author: Sam

reviews.title: "They keep declining into lower and lower quality."
reviews.text: Annoying.... I have been buying unfinished oak cabinets for the past 10 years. They've really plummeted in quality in the past 5, and now are harder and harder to find in stock at stores. I usually go to the "other" big box place for these, but they no longer stock them. I feel like a sucker for buying these cabinets from Lowes. First - the sides are now made out of much thinner particle board, and I'll have to attach some 1" x 3" to the inside upper edge of the base cabinets so they can actually support my table top/basic countertop. There are huge gaps where the hinges attach to the doors, and some doors don't close flush. Also - no shelves inside is idiotic. So now I have to fashion my own for this cabinet, which won't match, and there isn't even any way to attach them (ie. pre-drilled holes for shelf pegs. How chintzy. Lastly, the base cabinets are randomly 1" taller than usual... if you measure the front face from top to bottom, it's 31". Usually this measurement is 30".... this kind of screws me over because I am making a desk out of these cabinets and plan to remove the toekick. My desk is going to sit 3/4" higher than planned (30" is already higher than usual desk height) -- but also, in certain areas I was going to use a wall cabinet on the ground as a base cabinet. Usually you can line up a 30" high wall cabinet with the door/drawer face of a base cabinet. But now - it's off due to this random higher height. The standard height for base cabinets has always been 34-1/2". This arbitrary change is annoying. Sad that multiple places could ruin such a simple product... and it's not "you get what you pay for" because the pre-finished (laminate) cabinets are about the same quality, the flaws are just hidden by the laminate, yet you pay much more! If I knew this decline was going to happen I would have finished all my projects reliant on unfinished cabinets 5 years ago. They may be "out of fashion" but there is something very utilitarian and flexible about these cabinets that makes them classic. Not everyone wants plastic covered cabinets. Just because these are unfinished and ready to go doesn't mean they need to be made like garbage.
reviews.author: lowequality

questions.question: "Does this cabinet come with an adjustable shelf?"
questions.author: Lauren

answers.author: Cappers
answers.text: The unfinished base cabinets do not come with a shelf but are predrilled so you can either make a shelf from finished lumber or order one but I believe the shelves are expensive to order.

answers.author: Becky
answers.text: According to the product description, it comes with a shelf. I emailed and call customer service for clarification... The store manager at the Robinson, PA store verified that it does come with a shelf.

answers.author: DiamondNOWCustomerService
answers.text: Thanks for asking. The Unfinished base cabinets do not have shelves included. Thanks ~ Sherri

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: There is not an adjustable shelf.

questions.question: "Is a kick plate included for the bottom of the cabinet? And what weight rating for shelves?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Yes, this unit has a toe kick. Your remaining question cannot be answered at this time.

answers.author: Project Source Team
answers.text: Thanks for your question. The kick plate would need to be purchased separately. It is not included with the cabinet. The weight limit on all load bearing surfaces is 15 lbs. per square foot which would include all cabinet floors and shelves. Thanks ~ Sherri

questions.question: "can I get a lazy susan corner base 36""
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Project Source Team
answers.text: Thanks for reaching out to us. The Lazy Susan corner cabinet can be ordered. It is item # 730836. Please contact a Lowe's Associate for assistance. Thanks ~ Sherri

answers.author: Diamond
answers.text: Thanks for reaching out to us. The Lazy Susan corner cabinet can be ordered. It is item # 730836. Please contact a Lowe's Associate for assistance. Thanks ~ Sherri

questions.question: "What type of wood is the face of the cabinet made from?"
questions.author: James

answers.author: Project Source Team
answers.text: Thanks for your question. The Unfinished cabinet face frame is made with Oak wood. Thanks ~ Sherri

answers.author: Diamond
answers.text: Thanks for your question. The Unfinished cabinet face frame is made with Oak wood. Thanks ~ Sherri

questions.question: "Is hinge on right or left? Can it be changed?"
questions.author: Mark

answers.author: DiamondNOWCustomerService
answers.text: Great question. Yes, you can remove the door and hinge on the opposite side. Thanks ~ Sherri

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Yes, the hinge is reversible.

questions.question: "Can the fixed shelf be removed in order to install a rev a shelf pull out waste basket?"
questions.author: jillizbizi

answers.author: DiamondNOWCustomerService
answers.text: Thanks for asking. The Unfinished base cabinet does not have a shelf included. The opening size for the 18" base cabinet is 15" wide x 22" high. Hope this helps. Thanks ~ Paige

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: No, the fixed shelf can not be removed.

questions.question: "Is the 30 inch base cabinet actually 30 inches wide?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: DiamondNOWCustomerService
answers.text: Thanks for asking. The face frame measures 30" wide on the Base 30" cabinet. Thanks ~ Sherri

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Yes, this is 30" wide.

questions.question: "How much does the 36 inch base weight"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: The base will weigh 71 pounds.

answers.author: DiamondNOWCustomerService
answers.text: Thanks for asking. The Unfinished base 36" cabinet weighs 71lbs. Thanks ~ Sherri

questions.question: "Are the cabinet interiors pre-drilled to allow for shelves to be installed?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: OldSully
answers.text: There are 5 pre-drilled positions spaced 3" apart. The lowest position is at 7". One shelf is provided. The shelf supports are made of plastic. You may want to purchase a set of steel supports.

answers.author: DiamondNOWCustomerService
answers.text: Thanks for asking. The base cabinets are not drilled for shelves. Thanks ~ Sherri

questions.question: "does this unit come with 3 drawers also?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: DiamondNOWCustomerService
answers.text: Thanks for asking. Kitchen Classics offers a 3 Drawer base cabinet in 18" wide, but do not offer it in the 15" width. Thanks ~ Sherri

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: No, this unit has one drawer.
